text: Hi All, I am checking out HubSpot CMS so just wanted to know if it is a headless CMS or not?

Hey everyone! Adam here with gold partner ONEFIRE based out of central Illinois. Does anyone have any experience building a module in HubSpot (with the blog tool, maybe?) that displays earned media placements?
Like gamification of some sort?
It is not, but there is a pretty thorough REST API
Hello everyone. I'm integrating HubSpot CRM within a project for a client.

It seems the documentation on the python sdk is pretty incomplete. Sadly I cannot find platform specific resources on the documentations platform. When there is a demonstration of how to communicate with an endpoint the requests are built manually. Yet in the github readme it is clearly demonstrated that the sdk has built in functions to achieve that.

But on the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts|documentations platform>:
```# <https://pypi.org/project/HubSpot-api-client/>
import requests

url = "<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts>"

querystring = {"hapikey":"YOUR_HubSpot_API_KEY"}

payload = "{\"properties\":{\"company\":\"Biglytics\",\"email\":\"<mailto:bcooper@biglytics.net|bcooper@biglytics.net>\",\"firstname\":\"Bryan\",\"lastname\":\"Cooper\",\"phone\":\"<tel:(877)929-0687|(877) 929-0687>\",\"website\":\"<http://biglytics.net|biglytics.net>\"}}"
headers = {
    'accept': "application/json",
    'content-type': "application/json"
    }

response = requests.request("POST", url, data=payload, headers=headers, params=querystring)

print(response.text)```

I may be wrong but the SDK is a API wrapper of sorts which uses the API endpoints to communicate and provides you a simpler interface. You can use either a custom request in python or use the SDK to communicate.

Thank you. I am indeed aware that it is merely a helper to save me from building these requests manually. However I wish to have a more exhaustive list of the features and function names available (mainly so as to perform the typical CRUD actions) so I can take best advantage of that wrapper.
<@U38EZFVFE> No sir. More like a listing of media outlets a client has been quoted in. The module would display a roll of links users could click out to to read the article
ah..
Are they the same media outlets all the time and do they link to internal articles or external articles

Hi, I'm new to HubSpot and trying to troubleshoot some issues. I added a new dropdown menu (Under Resources) in my navigation, and my styles aren't applying to a menu list. How can I fix this? <https://www.cckb.biz/>
so css will only do what you tell it to…. SOO…. there needs to be a difference between the two sides.
normally its a class missing
`.nav-bar-left`
this will be your change
<@U01DFCAB60J> seems like you doubed up on the left side instead of making one of them right side
Ahhhh thanks for catching that.
